item.title: Cerberus 创始人前往华盛顿，为费恩伯格之后的生活做准备
item.description: 史蒂夫-费恩伯格（Steve Feinberg）花了三十多年的时间，将 Cerberus 资本管理公司打造成为私人市场上最具侵略性的公司之一。在他前往华盛顿担任国防部第二把手之际，他于 1992 年共同创立的公司正在为没有他的日子做准备。【原文：Steve Feinberg spent more than three decades building Cerberus Capital Management into one of the most aggressive players in private markets. As he heads to Washington to take the No. 2 job at the Defense Department, the firm he co-founded in 1992 is preparing for life without him.】

item.title: 尽管比索走强，阿根廷通货紧缩仍停滞不前
item.description: 尽管哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）总统放缓了比索的月度贬值速度，但阿根廷 2 月份的通货膨胀率仍略有上升。【原文：Argentina inflation picked up slightly in February, in spite of President Javier Milei’s move to slow down the peso’s monthly depreciation.】

item.title: 比特币在全市场的 "纾困反弹 "中从四个月低点回升
item.description: 比特币从本周早些时候触及的四个月低点反弹，其他风险资产也从近期全球市场的动荡中反弹。【原文：Bitcoin rebounded from the four-month low reached earlier in the week with other risky assets bouncing back from the recent turmoil seen in global markets.】

item.title: 第一量子子公司暂停对巴拿马的诉讼
item.description: 第一量子矿业有限公司（First Quantum Minerals Ltd）在当地的子公司巴拿马科布雷公司（Cobre Panama）指示其律师与政府的法律团队会面，并暂停就该公司在巴拿马已关闭的铜矿对巴拿马提起仲裁诉讼。【原文：Cobre Panama, the local subsidiary of First Quantum Minerals Ltd, instructed its lawyers to meet with the government’s legal team and suspend its arbitration suits against Panama over the firm’s shuttered copper mine in the country.】

item.title: 美国和欧盟官员探讨如何推进特朗普的贸易战
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收金属关税引发贸易战之后，欧盟行政机构高级成员和美国官员周五举行会谈，探讨如何向前迈进。【原文：Senior members of the European Union’s executive arm and US officials spoke on Friday to explore ways to move forward after US President Donald Trump’s metals tariffs prompted a trade war.】

item.title: 苹果公司 Siri 首席执行官称人工智能延迟既丑陋又令人尴尬，并承诺进行修复
item.description: 苹果公司负责监督 Siri 虚拟助手的高层管理人员告诉员工，关键功能的延误既难看又令人尴尬，而在该技术准备就绪之前就公开推广的决定更是雪上加霜。【原文：Apple Inc.’s top executive overseeing its Siri virtual assistant told staff that delays to key features have been ugly and embarrassing, and a decision to publicly promote the technology before it was ready made matters worse.】

item.title: 石油在休斯顿的返乡之旅因贸易战和价格下跌而黯然失色
item.description: 本周齐聚休斯顿的石油高管们深刻认识到，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普支持化石燃料的议程是有代价的：价格下降。【原文：Oil executives gathering in Houston this week learned the hard way that US President Donald Trump’s pro-fossil fuel agenda comes with a catch: lower prices.】

item.title: 加州保险业主管支持州立农场将费率上调 22
item.description: 加利福尼亚州保险专员里卡多-拉拉（Ricardo Lara）表示，他计划批准将州立农场投保人的费率紧急上调 22%，但要等待下个月的公开听证会，此举旨在稳定洛杉矶地区毁灭性野火后的州保险市场。【原文：California Insurance Commissioner Ricardo Lara said he plans to approve a 22% emergency rate increase for State Farm policyholders, pending a public hearing next month, in a move aimed at stabilizing the state’s insurance market after the Los Angeles area’s devastating wildfires.】

item.title: 在七国集团会议上，美国盟友的高级外交官们想知道卢比奥的立场
item.description: 在加拿大的一个山区疗养地，一些美国最亲密的盟友试图通过私下谈话和公开互动来推测国务卿马可-卢比奥（Marco Rubio）与其上司的真实立场。【原文：At a Canadian mountain retreat, some of the US’s closest allies tried to divine over private conversations and public interactions where Secretary of State Marco Rubio really stands vis-a-vis his boss.】

item.title: 哈佛法学院学生希望 530 亿美元基金与以色列断绝关系
item.description: 哈佛大学法学院的学生投票要求该校 530 亿美元的捐赠基金从 "武器、监控技术 "和其他与以色列有关联的公司中撤资，这一象征性的投票再次引起了人们对这场引起特朗普政府愤怒的抗议运动的关注。【原文：Harvard Law School students voted to demand the university’s $53 billion endowment divest from “weapons, surveillance technology” and other companies tied to Israel, a symbolic vote that brings renewed attention to a protest movement that has drawn the Trump administration’s ire.】

item.title: 马克-拉斯里称，在特朗普的不确定性下，经济 "无法生存
item.description: 大道资本集团（Avenue Capital Group）创始人之一、亿万富翁马克-拉西里（Marc Lasry）说，唐纳德-特朗普总统政策的不确定性，尤其是关税政策的不确定性，正在阻碍希望抓住市场机遇的投资者。【原文：Marc Lasry, the billionaire co—founder of Avenue Capital Group, said the uncertainty over President Donald Trump’s policies, particularly on tariffs, is stalling investors looking to take advantage of market opportunities.】

item.title: 美国经济也在断裂
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统推动增加国内石油产量和降低能源价格之际，花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Amid President Donald Trump’s push for more domestic oil output and lower energy prices, Citigroup Inc. is warning that the prospect of weakening returns threatens to stifle drilling.】

item.title: 挪威贸易大臣迈尔塞斯努力争取欧盟关税豁免
item.description: 挪威贸易大臣塞西莉-米尔塞特（Cecilie Myrseth）会见了欧盟官员，北欧国家正在寻求豁免欧盟为应对美国发起的贸易战而可能征收的广泛保护性关税。【原文：Norway’s Trade Minister Cecilie Myrseth met with European Union officials as the Nordic country seeks an exemption to any broad protective tariff the bloc could levy as a response to a US initiated trade war.】

item.title: 利润率骤降，Glencore 全面整顿陷入困境的加拿大冶炼厂
item.description: 继去年裁员后，Glencore Plc 将加倍努力削减加拿大铜锌厂的成本，这是继加工利润崩溃后对其全球冶炼业务的进一步整顿。【原文：Glencore Plc is doubling down on a cost-cutting drive at its Canadian copper and zinc plants following job cuts last year, in a further overhaul of its global smelting business following a collapse in processing margins.】

item.title: 经济担忧重创与美国人消费密切相关的股票
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统善变的贸易政策正在引发人们对美国经济稳定性的担忧，而最依赖美国消费者力量的股票也开始感受到压力。【原文：President Donald Trump’s fickle trade policies are raising concerns about US economic stability, and the stocks most reliant on the strength of the American consumer are starting to feel the pinch.】

item.title: Z 世代美国人的存款不足以支付一个月的开支
item.description: 美国年轻人的存款不足以支付一个月的开支，这表明一旦经济陷入衰退，他们就很容易受到影响。【原文：Younger Americans don’t have enough saved to cover a single month of spending, showcasing their vulnerability should the economy head into a downturn.】

item.title: 卡尼宣誓就任加拿大领导人，贸易将成为主要议程
item.description: 马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）宣誓就任加拿大第 24 任总理，这位前央行行长在与美国的爆炸性贸易战中上台执政。【原文：Mark Carney has been sworn in as Canada’s 24th prime minister, bringing the former central banker to power in the middle of an explosive trade war with the US.】

item.title: 荷兰银行因薪酬限制问题与荷兰中央银行交恶
item.description: 荷兰银行（ABN Amro Bank NV）表示，由于与荷兰中央银行在涉嫌违反薪酬限制的问题上存在意见分歧，该公司可能面临被罚款的风险。【原文：ABN Amro Bank NV said it could be at the risk of financial penalties as a result of a difference of opinion with the Dutch central bank over alleged violations of its pay restrictions.】

item.title: 南非财政部长否认在提高增值税问题上肆意妄为
item.description: 南非财政部长否认他无视国家财政部关于不将增值税提高两个百分点的建议，此举导致上个月的预算被推迟。【原文：South Africa’s finance minister denied that he ignored advice from the National Treasury not to raise value-added tax by two percentage points, the move that led to last month’s budget being postponed.】

item.title: Crayon 和 SoftwareOne 交易面临小股东的威胁
item.description: SoftwareOne Holding AG 公司以 129 亿克朗（11.4 亿美元）的价格收购挪威 Crayon Group Holding 公司的交易，可能会受到以十大股东为首的一批投资者的质疑。【原文：SoftwareOne Holding AG’s 12.9 billion-krone ($1.14 billion) takeover bid for Norwegian firm Crayon Group Holding may be challenged by a group of investors led by a top-10 shareholder.】

item.description:

item.title: 雅培、利洁时因法官批准重新审理婴儿配方奶粉案而倒下
item.description: 雅培实验室和利洁时集团股价下跌，原因是法官驳回了这两家公司因隐瞒早产儿配方奶粉潜在风险而被免除责任的判决，并下令重新审理。【原文：Abbott Laboratories and Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc shares fell as a judge ordered a new trial after rejecting a verdict that had cleared the companies of liability over claims they hid potential risks of their premature-infant formulas.】

item.title: 乐购供应商 Bakkavor 拒绝了 Greencore 11.4 亿英镑的收购要约
item.description: Bakkavor Group Plc 拒绝了爱尔兰方便食品制造商 Greencore Group Plc 提出的现金加股票的出价，该出价对这家在伦敦上市的公司的估值为 11.4 亿英镑（15 亿美元）。【原文：Bakkavor Group Plc rejected a cash and stock bid from Irish convenience food manufacturer Greencore Group Plc valuing the London-listed firm at £1.14 billion ($1.5 billion).】

item.title: 美国向北约施压，国防 ETF 吸金 14 亿美元
item.description: 随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）推动欧洲国家增加军费开支，专注于国防和军火公司的交易所交易基金正在快速流入。【原文：Exchange-traded funds focused on defense and arms companies are amassing inflows at a brisk clip as US President Donald Trump pushes for European countries to increase their military spending.】

item.title: 七国集团取消 "两国解决方案 "以推动公报通过
item.description: 七国集团外长已就一项联合声明达成共识，呼吁如果俄罗斯不同意停火，就对其实施更多制裁。但熟悉内情的人士说，只有在盟国向美国做出让步，包括不再提及以色列和巴勒斯坦冲突中的 "两国解决方案 "后，才有可能取得突破。【原文：Group of Seven foreign ministers have reached consensus on a joint statement calling for more sanctions on Russia if it doesn’t agree to a ceasefire. But the breakthrough was possible only after allies made concessions to the US, including removing any mention of a “two-state solution” in the conflict between Israelis and Palestinians, people familiar with the matter said.】
